hackathon-description-text: Software is eating the world and there is a huge opportunity for disruption in the Shipping, Ports and Logistics industries. Join 100+ participants (developers, business people, designers, domain experts, lawyers) for 48 hours of building prototypes, rapid fire market validation and business model invention.

hackathon-judges.judge-role: Executive Director, Port Authority of NY, NJ
Innovation Portfolio manager, Maersk Maritime Technology
Managing Director, Red Sea Gateway Terminal

hackathon-eligibility: All team participants must be registered on Eventbrite. Suggested team sizes are at least 4 or 5 people. All participants must be registered to Devpost.
hackathon-rules:
Behave professionally. Remember that discrimination and harassment* of any kind is not appropriate. This includes sex, race, color, religion, age, disability, sexual orientation, national or ethnic origin and status.
There will be a videographer on site during the event. By participating in this hackathon, you consent to being filmed or photographed.
Build something. To ensure a fair playing ground for all participants, all code must be fresh code, and adhere to the official time limitations of the event. If your team qualifies for prizes, the team will be subject to a code review to verify that there was no foul play.
Participants are encouraged to use sponsor provided data sets, APIs, open source projects, libraries, and frameworks.
hackathon-description-header: Disrupt the shipping, ports and logistics in 48 hours!

hackathon-prizes.prize-content: Meraki route (MR33 access point) with a 3 year license

hackathon-location-google-maps: https://maps.google.com/?q=315 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10165, USA
hackathon-location-address: 315 Madison Ave, New York, NY 10165, USA

hackathon-judging-criteria.judging-criterion:
Build a MVP. We are not looking for just power points.

customer and tech
ideally, a hack from this weekend will have potential for a pilot program
